issue.title: {Freeway-Bug}[Adaptive Cards - Blog]: Elements marked as presentational should not have global ARIA or tabindex to ensure all screen readers ignore them.

labels.name: A11ySev2
labels.description: Accessibility issue with severity 2. This may impact the accessibility score

labels.name: HCL-AdaptiveCards-Web
labels.description: Used by accessibility team for scorecard categorization

issue.body:
### Target Platforms

Other

### SDK Version

1.5

### Application Name

Adaptive Cards

### Problem Description

**Test Environment:**
OS: Version 23H2 (OS Build 25381.1)
URL: https://adaptivecards.io/blog/
Browser: Edge Dev Version 115.0.1880.3 (Official build) dev (64-bit)
Tool: Accessibility Insight For Web

**Repro Steps:**

1. Open the above URL in the edge dev browser.
2. Navigate to 'Blog' tab item and press enter key to activate it.
3. Run the AI Tool and observe the issue.

**Actual Result:**
Elements marked as presentational  have global ARIA or tabindex.

**Expected Result:**
Elements marked as presentational should not have global ARIA or tabindex to ensure all screen readers ignore them

**Element path:**
 .w3-cell-row.w3-padding-16:nth-child(1) > article:nth-child(1) > .w3-margin-top > .w3-cell-middle.w3-cell > a[href$="adaptivecards.io"][role="presentation"]

**How to fix:** 
Fix all of the following:
  Element is not focusable.

**Note:**
This issue is repro throughout the Blog screen.

**User Impact:**
It will impact the AT user if the element marked as presentational have Global Aria or Tab Index.

**WCAG Reference:**
https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/info-and-relationships

“Have feedback to share on Bugs? Please help fill [Trusted Tester Bug Feedback (office.com)](https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https://forms.office.com/pages/responsepage.aspx?id%3Dv4j5cvGGr0GRqy180BHbR5dUqGQgJ9lItv-jqY8F09lURVdYTENIRkY2UzlCR0NKV1E2VUE5OVpDVy4u&data=04%7c01%7cv-vaibgu%40microsoft.com%7c551850210d444be9b28308d9691e3dde%7c72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7c1%7c0%7c637656400980259288%7cUnknown%7cTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7c1000&sdata=TrcBaCyAPKg0WAQfdSZJP2i9pghMEDg59i2NeUUs5EQ%3D&reserved=0)“

### Screenshots

![WCAG1 3 1-Elements marked as presentational should not have global ARIA or tabindex to ensure all screen readers ignore them](https://github.com/microsoft/AdaptiveCards/assets/95913748/2ef40575-bf86-44e0-82b8-84561e6bcb18)

![image](https://github.com/microsoft/AdaptiveCards/assets/95913748/4196f49a-394e-49f7-9fc4-7d4921d8816d)


### Card JSON

```JSON
NA
```


### Sample Code Language

_No response_

### Sample Code

_No response_

issue.title: {Freeway-Bug}[Adaptive Cards - Blog]: Ensures role attribute has an appropriate value for the 'Community Call - October 2022'element

labels.name: A11ySev2
labels.description: Accessibility issue with severity 2. This may impact the accessibility score

labels.name: HCL-AdaptiveCards-Web

issue.body:
### Target Platforms

Other

### SDK Version

1.5

### Application Name

Adaptive Cards

### Problem Description

**Test Environment:**
OS: Version 23H2 (OS Build 25381.1)
URL: https://adaptivecards.io/blog/
Browser: Edge Dev Version 115.0.1880.3 (Official build) dev (64-bit)
Tool: Accessibility Insight For Web

**Repro Steps:**
1. Open the above URL in the edge dev browser.
2. Navigate to 'Blog' tab item and press enter key to activate it.
3. Run the AI Tool and observe the issue.

**Actual Result:**
Incorrect role attribute as 'Presentation' is defined for the 'Community Call - October 2022' element.

**Expected Result:**
Correct role should be defined for the 'Community Call - October 2022' element and it should be link.

**Element path:**
 .w3-cell-row.w3-padding-16:nth-child(1) > article:nth-child(2) > .coverImage[role="presentation"]

**How to fix:** 
Fix any of the following:
  ARIA role presentation is not allowed for given element

**Note:**
This issue is repro throughout the Blog screen.

**User Impact:**
It will impact the screen reader user if the incorrect role as presentation is defined for the elements.

**WCAG Reference:**
https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/name-role-value.html

“Have feedback to share on Bugs? Please help fill [Trusted Tester Bug Feedback (office.com)](https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https://forms.office.com/pages/responsepage.aspx?id%3Dv4j5cvGGr0GRqy180BHbR5dUqGQgJ9lItv-jqY8F09lURVdYTENIRkY2UzlCR0NKV1E2VUE5OVpDVy4u&data=04%7c01%7cv-vaibgu%40microsoft.com%7c551850210d444be9b28308d9691e3dde%7c72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7c1%7c0%7c637656400980259288%7cUnknown%7cTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7c1000&sdata=TrcBaCyAPKg0WAQfdSZJP2i9pghMEDg59i2NeUUs5EQ%3D&reserved=0)“

### Screenshots

![WCAG4 1 2-Ensures role attribute has an appropriate value for the elements](https://github.com/microsoft/AdaptiveCards/assets/95913748/a755ab06-ca28-4b86-82fc-81e0d477a50a)

![WCAG_4 1 2-Ensures role attribute has an appropriate value for the element](https://github.com/microsoft/AdaptiveCards/assets/95913748/07454ffb-8dcb-446b-940f-0a49d4bbc560)

issue.title: {Linked:Bug3118618} [Adaptive Cards > Action.Toggle Visibility] - Screen Reader is not conveying the 'Expanded/Collapsed' state for the more option button.

labels.name: A11ySev2
labels.description: Accessibility issue with severity 2. This may impact the accessibility score

labels.name: HCL-AdaptiveCards-Android
labels.description: Used by accessibility team for scorecard categorization

labels.name: HCL-AdaptiveCards-Web
labels.description: Used by accessibility team for scorecard categorization

issue.body:
### Target Platforms

Other

### SDK Version

1.0

### Application Name

Adaptive Cards

### Problem Description

**Test Environment:**
URL: https://adaptivecards.io/explorer/Action.ToggleVisibility.html
OS Version: 23H2(OS Build 25915.1000)
Browser Version: Edge Dev 117.0.2033.0
Screen Reader: Narrator

**Repro Steps:**
1. Open the URL on Edge Dev browser.
2. Press tab key and navigate to the 'More Option' button under 'Please confirm your data'.
3. Press enter key and observe the issue.

**Actual Result:**
While navigating to the 'More Option' button on pressing enter key, screen reader is not conveying the state information as 'Expanded'. It is simply announcing the information about the items present under it.

**Expected Result:**
Screen reader should convey the state information when user activates the 'More Option' button. It should announce as **'More Option button expanded then it should announce the items present under it.'**

**User Impact:**
Users who rely on screen readers will be affected if screen reader does not announce expand/collapsed state info for the controls present in the Action.toggle visibility screen. Due to this user will get confused and will not get idea that control is getting expanded/collapsed and this may cause distortion.

**MAS Reference:**
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/accessibility/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B507B5D90-F1B9-4AE1-91D1-2F1F2D6C7C1D%7D&file=MAS%204.1.2%20%E2%80%93%20Name%2C%20Role%2C%20Value.docx&action=default&mobileredirect=true&share=IQGQXXtQufHhSpHRLx8tbHwdAUoz-PLo6lZ2eagKqmDeOGc

Have feedback to share on Bugs? Please help fill [Trusted Tester Bug Feedback (office.com)](https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https:%2f%2fforms.office.com%2fpages%2fresponsepage.aspx?id%3Dv4j5cvGGr0GRqy180BHbR5dUqGQgJ9lItv-jqY8F09lURVdYTENIRkY2UzlCR0NKV1E2VUE5OVpDVy4u&data=04%7c01%7cv-ssachan%40microsoft.com%7c68d0243104da4caeb08708d9ba4d6c6b%7c72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7c1%7c0%7c637745663988426007%7cUnknown%7cTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7c3000&sdata=YMsEOknKWOki3Fi%2BatsKabxS%2BM1tfTrgnws52jzpI7M%3D&reserved=0).

### Screenshots


https://github.com/microsoft/AdaptiveCards/assets/95913748/6ae158f0-a128-454c-b0e1-607665c50439



### Card JSON

```JSON
NA
```

_No response_

pull_request.title: Fixed Overflow action button not announcing view chagnes
pull_request.body:
# Related Issue
Fixed #8654.

# Description
As focus is moved to a menu overlay from a button, buttons aria-expanded state is not announced by voice over. moved the aria-expanded to menu item itself, where the focus is set. When menu item closes, have the focus to be back on the button with aria-expanded set to false. however, with keyboard navigation, when 'return' key is used to close the menu item, it will trigger click event on the button when the focus is back to the button. In order to stop such behavior, preventDefault() was used.

# Sample Card
N/A

# How Verified

Manually verified.

Interesting, only commented on it because I saw the behavior on the test site. Not sure why, but it works correctly in regular mode, and doesn't work in scan mode.

Not blocking or anything though :)

comment.body:
@anna-dingler ,

navigating using keys up and down will remove the aria-expanded. when the menu item is rendered, we set the first item to be in focus.

comment.body:
nit: I'm wondering if we should set "aria-expanded" on the focused element?

Also FWIW, we might want to revisit this again later, because expanded is announced each time this menu item receives focus. I'm not sure it should be announced while navigating the list, only when the menu is first expanded.

commits.message:
[Carousel A11y]: Change focus order to first focus carousel pages and navigation controls second (#8709)

* focus carousel page before carousel navigation controls

* tabs to spaces

---------

Co-authored-by: Joseph Woo <Joseph.Woo@microsoft.com>
